name: Mantra Samui Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Context: We spent one week at Sala Samui and one week at Muang Samui Villas before finishing our Samui trip with five nights here. Just shy of $200 per night for the Cozy room, we wished we didn't leave our Choengmon resorts.
reviews.title: Great view but better options on Samui

reviews.text: Location: As other reviewers mentioned the views over to Koh Phangan are beautiful. We used the shuttle a couple of times to venture to Bhoput. The times work for lunch but to venture in for a convenient dinner required catching a taxi.
reviews.title: Better than a luxury 5 star hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: are about 3.5 star and were much smaller than our suites at Sala and Muang with odd decor/styling. The layout didn't work with a large chunk of space been taken up by a daybed with no pillows etc. The bath was very uncomfortable with the hot water deciding to work intermittently. And the toilet is adjacent to the bed which doesn't work if someone gets a bout of an upset stomach. There was no 'extras' like extra mirrors with good lighting in the bathroom, nowhere to put your suitcases etc. As our room was overlooking the pool we got some noise from pool goers.
reviews.title: relaxing home away from home

reviews.text: Food: The breakfast buffet was great. Coffee was hit and miss: the first one could be great and the second barely drinkable. They accommodated my gluten free needs however on the second morning I had a severe reaction so clearly something was not - I stayed clear of all gluten free carbs after that.
reviews.title: Fantastic Mountain Hideaway

reviews.text: We ate lunch and dinner here several times and the seafood was very fresh with brilliant flavours. The food and service (especially from On) was fantastic. Indeed the service makes this hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing as long as you dont mind the issolation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel as part of a package for 3 nights in Samui having read glowing reviews on this site. We were grossly disappointed with this hotel (and I almost never write scathing reviews) and was the WORST hotel we stayed at in Thailand. First, this is NOT a five or four star resort but a three-star budget hotel frequented by tour groups who I assume get a really good deal on the price- have no delusions this is a high end luxury resort. Yes the hotel has great views of the bay but as previously reported it is high on a hill- this provides a scary ( and I mean scary) incline at >85 degrees on the property requiring buggy rides to go up and down; The incline is so severe that we both almost fell off the buggy while coming up which is quite frankly dangerous-i doubt this hotel would have been approved in for safety in the US. The food at the restaurant is okay and service there was decent though when we asked for water we got the "cheeky" reply of "Its over there you can get up and get it yourself" though this was done with a smile! The spa is a good value and the staff was quite nice. The rooms are cheap and tatty- desperately trying to be a high end hotel like the Standard or Mondrian in LA but fall grossly below those standards. The bathroom becomes completely wet after a shower since there is no proper door to the shower only a glass wall.
reviews.title: Cheeky with love, means Rude with an Excuse......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel offers some nice free amenities such as Wi-Fi and calls to anywhere in the world BUT charges you for in room coffee/snacks which are free at other properties.
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The worst part however was the rude and abnoxious, "cheeky" front office staff (if you can call it that as it an open air room without a real front desk). I had to download an attachment from my email which did not work with the in room wi-fi; asked the front desk for help and the rude front office manager replied "You cant download it, we dont allow it" I asked if they had a computer to use and their response was "No there is nothing you can do" rolled her eyes, said something in Thai (I doubt it was flattering) and walked off. Later when I asked for change for a 1000 Thai bhat note her response was "We dont give change" and again walked off.
reviews.title: Got a great deal

reviews.text: Additionally, if you want to enjoy the beautiful crystal clear waters of Samui-this hotel is a 20 minute bumpy ride on a dusty road drive away. The shuttle was dismal and drops you off on a dirt road about 400 meters from the main area. My advice: Pay a little more money stay on the beach and avoid this hotel. We went to the W which was across the street which was amazing........
reviews.title: Beautiful resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Mantra Koh Samui Resort Thailand and am happy to recommend this Resort to you. The room was great with fabulous Ocean Views. The Food (Breakfast & Dinner) was sensational and the free Shuttle each day to/from Chewang Beach was convenient. The staff were very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Stunning views!

reviews.text: We had a wonderfull time here in May, with our kids: Laurens, Wouter and Lonneke. It is a quiet and beautiful resort. The shuttle bus is perfect, although it takes a good planning of your day. The staff is very helpfull and friendly. The restaurant is okay, but a bit more expansive than the restaurants in Bophut.We enjoyed the serenity and wonderfull treatment in the Spa. The gym has very good equipment. The resort itself, with its steep hills, is a good training as well. But as stated in other reviews nescessary to get rid of the calories you take at breakfast. We hope nto come back in the future. The place is enjoyable for older children ( ours are 15-18y ), maybe a bit less for younger children.
reviews.title: Wonderfull resort

reviews.text: Robert heads an extraordinarily dedicated and well trained team at this steep hillside resort, quiet and away from the madding crowds. Our party of six has just spent 8 nights there. An older member had two new knees and one of our teenagers had his wheelchair/ walker! However we never waited more than 5 minutes for a buggy and the staff fell over themselves to help our group.
reviews.title: Wow! SERVICE! Every member of staff goes the extra mile!

reviews.text: SERVICE is the key to the resort's success.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort affords panoramic views across the treetops towards the village and sea in the distance. it's about ten minutes into town by the shuttle service and if your schedule doesn't fit theirs, just ask for the time you need. EVERYONE tries to do what you request so there's no need to complain after your visit - ask during your stay for whatever you want/need.
reviews.title: AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: The restaurant offers a diverse and interesting menu for all meals and isn't expensive by our (Australian) standards.
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay!

reviews.text: Staff were amazing!!! Reception staff always looked after you and we're most helpful nothing was ever too much trouble views were sensational and the rooms were spacious and comfortable we had a family of 4
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: Stayed at Mantra in a Grand Family room (2 Wow rooms) from 5th - 13th July with 2 young Children (Cohen & Jackson). Had an amazing time and most of it being down to Mantra's staff and the stunning infinity pool with spectacular views. No it's not a 5 star hotel but I don't feel I paid 5 star prices. Yes it's a little out the way and on a steep hill but we knew that and Mantra do all they can to overcome this and do it successfully. Food is good, Gym is great, free internet, shuttles to Bophut & Chaweng and did I mention the pool!! Special mention to Sai, Zita and Tor who were fab with the kids and also to Robert the manager for his effort made with the guests and his staff, taking time to chat to everyone and mucking in with serving breakfast etc. Many just hide away in their office. Will defo go back and recommend to others.
reviews.title: Cheeky With Love

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mantra Samui is perfect. From the moment we arrived the service was brilliant. My boyfriend and I stayed her for 6 nights after a week of backpacking. It was just what we needed. The hotel is full of sweet personal touches. The staffs were helpful, polite and spoke brilliant English. The hotel has an infinity pool and a swim up bar. We were given a free upgrade to the room. The restraint serves food all day; room service is available 24 hours a day. Try the pizza’s as the pizza chief is amazing. The staffs were really helpful changing meals to a vegetarian option if i asked. We had maid service every day. The hotel is out of the way, but this is not hidden at any point, that’s what gives it it’s amazing views. The hotel does offer a shuttle service and taxi’s are not that expensive. Compared to other places we visited in Thailand this hotel was slightly more expensive however, for 5 star services what do you expect. The owner of the hotel is a true asset to the hotel staff, you can always see him working in the restaurant, delivering room service, in reception; he really gets joined in and it’s really nice to see. Breakfast is a buffet each morning, so much choice!
reviews.title: Perfect :)

reviews.text: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Mantra. We stayed for a total of 10 nights in Koh Samui and chose to spend our last few nights at the mantra based on the trip advisor reviews. We wanted a bit of luxury so didn't hesitate in booking.
reviews.title: Nice hotel shame about the location

reviews.text: The hotel itself is lovely and the gardens and pool are stunning. I did however feel the area for the loungers is very small in relation to the size of the hotel and is quite cramped.
reviews.title: Great views, five star service and a wonderful friendly host Robert

description: The Mantra Samui Boutique Resort***** is located 10 minutes from Bophut Beach with our complimentary shuttle service (provided multiple times a day)or with a scooter or a car. Enjoy our amazing range of Facilities that include: Squash Courts, Himalayan Salt Yoga Studio, Steam Room and Sauna, Fully Equipped Fitness Center, Two Restaurants, Swim Up Bar, a Cinema, a Kids Club and a Game Room. An amazing Sea View can be enjoyed from all of the WOW, LOVE, COZY and GRAND rooms.Most importantly The Five Star Mantra has the friendliest and most professional staff on the island
